p: In Exp. 1 (48 h), all of the treatments increased the relative abundance of Proteobacteria and decreased that of Firmicutes and Bacteroidetes. Wallace et al. (2015) found out that in beef cattle, there was a 4-fold abundance of Proteobacteria in animals with lower CH 4 emissions compared to those with higher emissions. Similarly, Danielsson et al. (2017) reported a higher abundance of Proteobacteria in low-CH 4 emitting cows than in high-CH 4 emitting ones. These results appear to agree with the results for the EUCA and CAM treatments in Exp. 1.
